item.title: Lending Out Your Credit
item.description: This post is about protecting your credit. Not from fraud… From family and friends. I’ve never experienced this but I know people who have. These people were co-signers on a loan for family members who either didn’t pay on time or at all on the loan.

item.title: Making sure you get the right mortgage advice
item.description: There is no denying the fact that you are offered with a plenty of options in terms of the mortgage when you plan to buy your first home or to refinance your existing home.

item.title: What are the Real Costs of Mortgage Advice and Who Pays a Broker’s Commission?
item.description: It is vital to go through all the details, contact many lenders when someone is looking for a mortgage. But, all of that is a lot of work and to avoid ending up making some mistakes, it is the best solution to hire a mortgage broker.

item.title: 7 Steps To Buying a Home
item.description: It’s important to understand the home buying process so I’ve created a 7-step checklist. Step 1: Down Payment The hardest part to buying a home is saving the down payment (a gift from the Bank of Mom & Dad also works).

item.title: 20 Terms that Home Buyers Need to Know
item.description: Buying a home is one of the most important financial decisions you will make. It’s common for a first-time home buyer to be overwhelmed when it comes to real estate industry jargon, so this BLOG is to help make some of the jargon understandable.
